cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi north of the western tip of Cuba and about 300 mi southwest of Fort Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast across the southern and central Florida Peninsula on Saturday, then moving into the southwestern Atlantic north of the north-western Bahamas Sunday and beyond
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Marco Island / Naples area on the southwest Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuban provinces of Matanzas and the Isle of Youth
weather_observation.warning_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Card Sound Bridge, the Florida Keys (incl. Dry Tortugas), Florida Bay, west coast of Florida south of the Middle of Longboat Key to Card Sound Bridge, Lake Okeechobee, and the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and central Florida Peninsula (both coasts), the Florida Keys, and the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with occasional gusts to near 50 mph possible Saturday daytime through Saturday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above ground possible along the Broward County coast and inside Biscayne Bay at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches likely with isolated totals near 12 inches; significant flash and urban flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes over South Florida could briefly affect port operations
